block.p: Danne Lynette Bullock, a daughter of Rainelle Logan of Detroit and Danny L. Bullock of Buffalo, is to be married today to Reginald Duane Johnson, the son of Jacqueline T. Johnson and Rayfield Johnson Jr. of Milwaukee. The Rev. Robert O. Dulin Jr. is to perform the nondenominational ceremony at the Charles H. Wright Museum of African American History in Detroit.

The bride, 31, is an associate counsel in the insurance and annuity unit of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company in Manhattan. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received a law degree from George Washington University. Her mother retired as a lieutenant in the Detroit Police Department. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

Danne Lynette Bullock, a daughter of Rainelle Logan of Detroit and Danny L. Bullock of Buffalo, is to be married today to Reginald Duane Johnson, the son of Jacqueline T. Johnson and Rayfield Johnson Jr. of Milwaukee. The Rev. Robert O. Dulin Jr. is to perform the nondenominational ceremony at the Charles H. Wright Museum of African American History in Detroit.

The bride, 31, is an associate counsel in the insurance and annuity unit of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company in Manhattan. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received a law degree from George Washington University. Her mother retired as a lieutenant in the Detroit Police Department. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

The bridegroom, 28, is an associate in the global investment banking unit of Deutsche Bank Securities in Manhattan. He graduated from Morris Brown College. His mother teaches third grade at River Trail Elementary School in Milwaukee. His father is a technical analyst in Waukesha, Wis., for Lucent Technologies.

The couple met in 1996 while interviewing to join the board of Miracle Makers, a social services agency in Brooklyn. She is now the chairwoman of the organization, and he is its assistant treasurer. The bride and bridegroom are also members of the Manhattan Advisory Board of the New York Urban League.
